alert.note: Alert for Jasper; Lauderdale; Newton (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 15 at 10:23PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Jasper, Newton and Lauderdale Counties through 1100 PM CDT... At 1023 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Martin to near Moss. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Moss around 1030 PM CDT. Suqualena around 1035 PM CDT. Nellieburg around 1040 PM CDT. Meridian around 1045 PM CDT. Marion around 1050 PM CDT. Zero around 1100 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Chunky, Montrose, Louin and Hickory. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. High winds can bring down trees and large limbs resulting in serious injury or property damage. Exercise extreme caution when outdoors during such strong winds...and be especially aware of older trees. These winds may occur even before thunder is heard.
